newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: NIB unit buys stake in French TCRE Fund.
newsitem.headline: NIB unit buys stake in French TCRE Fund.

text.p: Nationale Investeringsbank NV (NIB) said on Friday its venture capital subsidiary PARNIB Holding had taken a minority stake in France's TCRE Fund.

The French fund is active as an intermediary in medium-sized and large buy-outs in France. It was set up by the Bemberg family who still owns part of the fund. Other shareholders are French and U.S. investment companies, NIB said.
A NIB spokesman declined to specify the size of PARNIB's interest in TCRE Fund but said the stake was "substantial" and would give PARNIB a representation in TCRE's investment committee.
PARNIB has set up various international cooperation pacts in recent years.
It took part in a joint venture in Denmark with investment bank FIH and last year took a stake in Germany's leveraged buy-out specialist Quadriga.
In 1996, PARNIB also bought an interest in London's Pricoa Capital Group which specialises in mezzanine financing throughout Europe.
